intro: Alloiatheros ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous alpine orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its botanical features include a short, rhizomatous stem and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
